gurmukhi: suMdr jwih krI kuibjw iCn bIc sugMD lgwvq bwgy ]so pRB Awpny kwrj hyq su jwq hY rIC ky Kojih lwgy ]2048]
transliteration: Soundar Jaah(i) Karikoubijaa Chhin Beech Sougaddh Lagadvat Baage|| So Prabh Aapane Kaaraj Het Su Jaat Hai Reech Ke Khojah(i) Laage||2048||
translation: He, who made Kubja, a most beautiful woman in an instant and incensed the atmosphere; the same Lord is going in search of the bear for his task.2048.

gurmukhi: Koj lIey sB eyk guPwhU mY jwq Bey hir AYsy aucwrXo ]hY koaU sUr DsY ieh bIc n kwhUM blI purK`q sMBwrXo ]
transliteration: Khoj Leee Sabh Ek Gouphaahoo Mai Jaat Bhae Har(i) Aise Ouchaarryo|| Hai Ko( i)  Soor Dhasai Eh Beech Na Kaahoon Balipurkhatt Sanbhdaryo||
translation: All of them discovered him in a cave, then Krishna said, “Is there any powerful person who can enter this cave;” but none of them gave a reply in the affirmative;

gurmukhi: XwhI ky bIc DsXo soeI rIs sBo mn mY iqh BwNiq ibcwrXo ]koaU khY nih Xw mY khXo hir ry hm Koj iehI mih fwrXo ]2049]
transliteration: Yaahike Beech Dhasyo Soirees Sabho Man Mai Tih Bhaant(i) Bichdaryo|| Ko( i)  Kahai Nah(i) Yaa Mai Kahyo Har(i) Re Ham Khoj Ihimaih Ddaryo||2049||
translation: Everyone thought that the bear was in the same cave, but still some of them said that he had not entered it; Krishna said that the bear was in that cave.2049.

gurmukhi: koaU n bIr guPw mY DsXo qb Awp hI qwih mY sXwm gXo hY ]Bwlk lY suD bIc guPwhU ky juDu ko swmuih kop AXo hY ]
transliteration: Ko( i)  Na Beer Gouphaa Mai Dhasyo Tab Aap Hitaah(i) Mai Syaam Gado Hai|| Dhaalak Lai Sudh Beech Gouphaahoo Ke Judh(u) Ko Saamuh(i) Kop Ayo Hai||
translation: When none of the present heroes went into the cave, Krishna himself went therein; the bear also imagined the arrival of somebody and in great fury, rushed forward for fighting;

gurmukhi: sXwm jU sXwm BnY auh so idn dÍwds bwhn ju`Du kXo hY ]ju`Du ieqy jug cwrn mY nr hÍYhY kbY kbhU n BXo hY ]2050]
transliteration: Syaam Joo Syaam Bhanai Uh So Din Dvaadas Baahan Juddh(u) Kayo Hai|| Juddh(u) Ite Joug Chaaran Mai Nah Hvai-hai Kabai Kab-hoo Na Bhayo Hai||2050||
translation: The poet says that Krishna waged such a battle with him for twelve days, which has not been fought earlier and will not be fought afterwards in the four ages.2050.

gurmukhi: dÍwds idaus iBry idn rYn nhI iqh qy hir nYk frwno ]lwqn mUkn ko Aiq hI Pun qaun guPw mih ju`Du mcwno ]
transliteration: Dvaadas Dios Bhire Din Rain Nahitih Te Har(i) Naik Daraanol Laatan Moondan Ko At(i) Hiphoun Taoun Gouphaa Maih Juddh(u) Machaano||
translation: For twelve days and nights, Krishna continued fighting and did not feel afraid, even slightly; there was dreadful battle with legs and fist,

gurmukhi: paurK Bwlk ko Gt gXo ieh mY bhu paurKqw phcwno ]ju`Du ko Cwif kY Dwie prXo jdubIr ko rwm shI kr jwno ]2051]
transliteration: Paurakh Dhaalak Ko Ghat Gyo Eh Mai Bahu Paurkhataa Pahchaano|| Juddh(u) Ko Chhaad(i) Kai Dhaae Daryo Jadoubeer Ko Raam Sahikar Jaano||2051||
translation: Feeling the strength of Krishna, the power of the bear declined; he abandoned th fighting and considering Krishna as the Lord, he fell down at his feet.2051.

gurmukhi: pwie prXo iGiGAwno Gno bqIXw Aiq dIn hÍY Xw ibD BwKI ]ho qum rwvn ky mrIAw qum hI pun lwj dropqI rwKI ]
transliteration: Paae Daryo Ghighiaano Ghano Bateeyaa At(i) Deen Hvai Yaa Bidh Bhaakhee|| Ho Toum Raavan Ke Dareeaa Toum Hipoun Laaj Daropatiraakhee||
translation: He beseeched earnestly on falling at his feet and said with utter humility, “You are the killer of Ravana and the saviour of the honour of Draupadi;

gurmukhi: BUl BeI hm qy pRB jU su iCmw krIXY iSv sUrj swKI ]XO kih kY duihqw ju huqI soaU lY biRjnwQ kY A`gRj rwKI ]2052]
transliteration: Bhool Bhaiham Te Prabh Joo Su Chhimaa Dareeyaa Shiv Sooraj Saakhee|| Yau Kah(i) Kai Duhitaa Ju Houtisooo Lai Barijnaath Kai Aggraj Raakhee||2052||
translation: “O Lord ! considering Surya and Chandra as my witnesses, I request for the forgiveness of my fault;” saying this, he presented before Krishna his daughter as an offering.2052.

gurmukhi: auq ju`D kY sXwm jU bXwh kXo ieq hÍY kY inrws ey Dwmn Awey ]kwnH guPwhU ky bIc Dsy soaU kwhU hny su iehI Thrwey ]
transliteration: Out Juddh Kai Syaam Joo Byaah Kayo It Hvai Kai Niraas E Dhaamanndaae|| Kaahn Gouphaahoo Ke Beech Dhase Sooo Kaahoo Hane Su Ehithahraae||
translation: On that side Krishna married after fighting and on this side, his companions standing outside came back to their homes, they believed that Krishna who had gone in the cave had been killed by the bear;
